Tuition reimbursement is limited and comes with restrictive conditions for those not hired in a "pre-B" track. If that's what you're looking for, make sure to discuss that concretely before being hired. They hire a ton of Ivy graduates, that though they may be smart, lack common sense and self-awareness. This can be a frustrating to work with.

headline: Perfect early in career.  Good people, good pay and amazing perks.
pros: This is my second job early in my career and am very happy.  The pay and benefits are great.  The office is beautiful.  All the people I work with are really down to earth and understanding.  I could see myself being here for a few years or for a couple decades.  It all depends on the promotion track.  Otherwise I have no intentions of leaving at the moment.
cons: Political like most companies are and a very structured promotion schedule.
